rbvs

Class Restaurant

  • java.lang.Object
    • rbvs.Restaurant

  • public class Restaurant
extends Object
    This class allows to manage a product assortment, tables and orders for a restaurant.

    Restaurant has a name for identification. It allows to order IProducts for a Table from an IProduct assortment. All Orders are organized in the Restaurant and can be accessed at all times.

    It also serves as the main entry point for the application.

    Attributes of the class:

    • A name for identification
    • List of IProducts
    • List of Tables
    • List of Orders
    • The number of already created Orders used to generate a unique identifier for new Orders (newOrderId = LastOrderId+1).

      • orderHistory

        private List<Order> orderHistory
        A list of all Orders. This list contains all orders that have been made at the restaurant regardless of their OrderState.

        private long uniqueOrderIdentifier
        A unique identifier for the Orders in the restaurant. This unique identifier should be increased with each new Order.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns the name of the restaurant.
        Returns:
        the name of the restaurant

      • createTable

        public boolean createTable(String tableIdentifier)
        Creates and adds a new table in the restaurant.

        The table is uniquely identified with its table identifier. Before creating a new Table this method checks whether the identifier is already in use. If the identifier is already in use, the Table can not be created and the method returns false. Otherwise the table is created and added to the list of associated Tables. If the table identifier is already used this method will have no effect and returns false.

        Parameters:
        tableIdentifier - the identifier of the new Table
        Returns:
        true, if Table is created successful, false otherwise.

      • getTableIdentifiers

        public List<String> getTableIdentifiers()
        Returns a list of Table identifiers.
        Returns:
        a list of Table identifiers

      • getSpecificTable

        public Table getSpecificTable(String identifier)
        Returns a specific Table based on its identifier.

        If no such Table it returns NULL.

        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of the Table
        Returns:
        the specific Table or NULL if not found.

      • addProduct

        public boolean addProduct(IProduct product)
                   throws DuplicateProductException
        Adds a copy of the IProduct to the assortment.

        The given IProduct is added to the assortment only if it is not already contained. If a IProduct is already contained in the assortment a DuplicateProductException is thrown. The evaluation is done based on Object.equals(Object). If the given IProduct is NULL it is not added and false is returned. The method returns true if the IProduct is successfully added, and false otherwise.

        Parameters:
        product - the IProduct to be added
        Returns:
        true, if IProduct added successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        DuplicateProductException - thrown if the IProduct is already in the assortment

      • addProduct

        public boolean addProduct(Collection<IProduct> products)
                   throws DuplicateProductException
        Adds copies of IProducts to the assortment.

        Each entry in the IProduct list that is NULL is skipped. If a IProduct is already contained in the assortment a DuplicateProductException is thrown. The check for already contained IProducts is done based on Object.equals(Object). The method returns true if all IProducts are successfully added, and false if at least one was not added.

        Parameters:
        products - the IProducts to be added
        Returns:
        true, if all IProducts successfully added.
        Throws:
        DuplicateProductException - thrown if the IProduct is already in the assortment

      • getProducts

        public List<IProduct> getProducts()
        Returns a list of copies of all IProducts in the assortment.
        Returns:
        a list of IProducts

      • orderProductForTable

        public boolean orderProductForTable(Table table,
                                    IProduct product)
        Orders a IProduct on a Table.

        First, the method checks if the parameters are valid. They are valid if they are not NULL and if they are available in the Restaurant (e.g. the assortment contains the IProduct and the Table is available in the Restaurant).

        Second, the IProduct is retrieved from the assortment.

        Third, a new Order is created with a unique identifier and the Table and Product are associated with the Order.

        Fourth, the Order is stored in the Restaurant.

        The method returns true if the IProduct can be ordered and false in all other cases.

        Parameters:
        table - The Table where the IProduct should be ordered.
        product - The IProduct that should be ordered.
        Returns:
        true if the IProduct has been ordered, false otherwise.

      • orderProductForTable

        public boolean orderProductForTable(Table table,
                                    IProduct product,
                                    int count)
        Orders a number of IProducts on a Table.

        First, the method checks if the parameters are valid. They are valid if they are not NULL and if they are available in the Restaurant (e.g. the assortment contains the IProduct and the Table is available in the Restaurant).

        Second, the IProduct is retrieved from the assortment.

        Third, a new Order is created with a unique identifier and the Table and Products are associated with the Order.

        Fourth, the Order is stored in the Restaurant.

        The method returns true if the IProduct can be ordered and false in all other cases.

        Parameters:
        table - The Table where the IProduct(s) should be ordered.
        product - The IProduct that should be ordered.
        count - The number of IProducts that should be ordered.
        Returns:
        true if the IProducts have been ordered, false otherwise.

      • containsProduct

        public boolean containsProduct(IProduct compareProduct)
        Checks if a IProduct is contained in the IProduct assortment.
        Parameters:
        compareProduct - The IProduct to check
        Returns:
        true if the IProduct is contained, false otherwise.

      • findProduct

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The IProduct matching the name or NULL if none is found.

        Returns:

      • generateUniqueIdentifier

        private long generateUniqueIdentifier()
        Increases the uniqueOrderIdentifier by one and returns it.
        Returns:
        an identifier as a long value

      • generateSimpleProducts

        public static List<IProduct> generateSimpleProducts()
        Generates test data in form of a SimpleProduct list. The list has to contain at least five SimpleProducts.
        Returns:
        a list of SimpleProducts

      • generateCompositeProducts

        public static List<IProduct> generateCompositeProducts()
        Generates test data in form of a CompositeProduct list. The list has to contain at least three CompositeProducts. Each CompositeProduct has to contain at least three Products, from which one Product has to be a CompositeProduct. This nested CompositeProduct has to contain three Products itself.
        Returns:
        a list of CompositeProducts

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Main entry point of the Application

        Implement following requirements:

        • Create product assortment
          • Create at least 5 SimpleProducts.
          • Create at least 5 ExtendedProducts.
          • Create at least 2 CompositeProduct containing SimpleProduct or ExtendedProduct only.
          • Create at least 2 CompositeProduct containing CompositeProduct.
          • Try to add a duplicate IProduct.
        • Create at least 3 tables.
        • Order IProducts.
          • Use any method enabling you to order products in the Restaurant at least once.
          • Each table in the restaurant must have at least 2 orders.
        • Implement a console-based menu offering following possibilities:
          • Searching for a product based on its name.
          • Adding a new product to the product assortment.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments

        toString in class Object
